name.en: Introduction to Wavelet Transform and its Applications

goal.ch: 這門課程的目標是為學生提供對小波理論及其在信號和影像處理、數據分析等方面的實際應用的全面理解。通過探索基本概念、不同類型的小波變換和實際應用，學生將發展出在各個領域有效應用小波分析所需的知識和技能。
goal.en: The goal of this course is to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of wavelet theory and its practical applications in signal and image processing, data analysis, and beyond. By exploring fundamental concepts, different types of wavelet transforms, and real-world applications, students will develop the knowledge and skills necessary to apply wavelet analysis effectively in various fields.

outline.ch:
這門課程介紹了小波變換的理論和應用。從小波的基本概念開始，課程進一步涵蓋了各種類型的小波變換、它們的性質，以及在信號和影像處理、數據壓縮等領域的實際應用。課程內容包括了理論和應用，以加強對知識的理解和實踐。課程內容分列如下：
一、小波介紹：本部分奠定了理解小波及其在信號和影像處理中的重要性的基礎。通過與傅立葉變換的比較，幫助學生把握小波分析的獨特特點和優勢。
二、連續小波變換（CWT）：定義連續小波變換並介紹小波分析的基本概念，以及其在分析連續時間信號中的應用。理解連續小波變換的性質對於進一步探索信號處理方面的應用至關重要。
三、離散小波變換（DWT）：與離散傅立葉變換（DFT）類似，我們在小波變換中有類似的概念。我們將討論離散小波變換的定義和性質，並介紹計算離散小波變換的馬拉特算法、小波包及其構造。
四、多分辨率分析（MRA）：多分辨率分析是小波理論中的一個關鍵概念，將一部分課程用於此可讓學生更深入地研究小波變換的數學基礎。探索正交和雙正交小波基的構造，使學生全面理解小波基函數。
五、應用：本部分通過探索小波變換的各種應用擴展了課程的範圍。涵蓋信號處理、去噪、特徵提取、影像處理、數據分析和壓縮感知等主題，展示了小波分析在不同領域的多功能性和有效性。
outline.en:
This course introduces students to the theory and applications of wavelet transforms. Starting with the fundamental concepts of wavelets, the course progresses to cover various types of wavelet transforms, their properties, and practical applications in signal and image processing, data compression, and other fields. The course includes theoretical lectures as well as hands-on exercises to reinforce understanding and practical skills. The content of this course is outlined as follows:
1.Introduction to Wavelets: This section sets the foundation for understanding wavelets and their significance in signal and image processing. Comparing wavelets with the Fourier transform helps students grasp the unique features and advantages of wavelet analysis.
2. Continuous Wavelet Transform (CWT): Explaining the continuous wavelet transform introduces students to the fundamental concept of wavelet analysis and its application in analyzing continuous-time signals. Understanding the properties of CWT is crucial for further exploration in signal processing applications.
3. Discrete Wavelet Transform (DWT): Drawing parallels with the discrete Fourier transform (DFT) is an excellent approach to help students transition from familiar concepts to wavelet transforms. Introducing the Mallat algorithm and wavelet packets enhances practical understanding and implementation skills.
4. Multi-resolution Analysis (MRA): MRA is a pivotal concept in wavelet theory, and dedicating a section to it allows students to delve deeper into the mathematical foundations of wavelet transforms. Exploring the construction of orthogonal and biorthogonal wavelet bases provides students with a comprehensive understanding of wavelet basis functions.
5. Applications: This section broadens the scope of the course by exploring various applications of wavelet transforms. Covering topics such as signal processing, denoising, feature extraction, image processing, data analysis, and compressive sensing showcases the versatility and effectiveness of wavelet analysis across different fields.
